text: Ras ben Sakka (Arabic for "Cape Ben Sakka") is the northernmost point of the African continent, extending from Cape Angela in northern Tunisia into the Mediterranean Sea. It is located from Bizerte and to the northeast of Ichkeul Lake World Heritage Site. It is located just west of Cape Blanc (, "White Cape"; Arabic:Ras al-Abyad), which is also often (mistakenly) described as the northern tip of Africa. Ras ben Sakka reaches about further north than the other. ==References== Category:Bizerte Ben Sakka Category:Populated coastal places in Tunisia
title: Ras ben Sakka
